p: Baroreflex sensitivity, and consequently the ability to keep blood pressure within bounds, also decreases as a function of age, in a manner associated with hypertension [ 16]. The rate of pulse-synchronous bursts of skeletal muscle sympathetic nerve traffic increases with aging [ 170]; however, arterial baroreflex control of muscle sympathetic nerve traffic [ 117] and of cardiovagal outflow is decreased in the elderly [ 16].
